185182898.review:
This game is a VERY difficult one to recommend and, if I could, I'd give it a neutral rating.

It's the Disgaea 2 you know and love, and it's just as good as ever. The content isn't where my issues are. My issues are that the game crashes if your controller disconnects for even a split second. NIS/NISA have done nothing to fix it. You'll probably be fine if you have a wired controller, but if you have a wireless one, be prepared for the occasional crash caused by a controller disconnect, and before you do any big dives into the Item World, make sure your batteries are fresh and do a reconnect on your controller to give yourself the best chance possible.

If you're using a wired controller or mouse and keyboard, you'll be fine. It's the same Disgaea 2 you know and love.

184183006.review:
If you like tactical RPGs and lots of grinding, crazy numbers, minmaxing, etc., you'll love this game. This is probably the best game in the series alongside with Disgaea 5. I played this game well over 250+ hours on my PS2 and 180+ hours here on Steam. This PC version is an improved version of the PS2, with HD hud and text and some extra content too.

My overall score: 4.2 / 5 --- Highly recommended if you're a fan of JRPGs, tactical RPGs, grinding, min-maxing, etc.

Gameplay: 4/5
Great tactical game, fast paced. It can be approached in two different ways: 1. You can play it casually, just to finish the story and that's it; 2. You can play it hardcore, grinding like crazy to explore all the post-game content (that is basically 95% of the game).

Graphics: 3/5
Nothing special about it, just the improved hud and font.

Story: 3/5
It's an interesting story with plot twists and fan-service, involving characters from the first game.

Replayability: 5/5
Actually 100/5, because the game only really shines in the post-game (Item World, Land of Carnage, extra bosses, etc.). I really enjoyed the grinding on this game, and it's really accomplishing to see the numbers on your characters going up. I even perfected a Super Robo Suit following Ulillillia's guide (maximum respect for that dude).

Music: 5/5
Awesome music. No surprise coming from a JRPG.

PC Requirements: 5/5
A toaster will do.

Multiplayer: It's a single player game, so it doesn't apply.
